with the intoxicated yapping and the blaring music, it can get crazy loud. but just throw back another strong and cheap drink, sink into the high-walled booths and create your own ruckus to drown out everyone else.

YEE-HAW!!!!
author: Emily L.

description: House of Shields seems to be the happy medium of bars.  It's not fancy and pretentious, nor is it divey.  It just has a nice, wood-paneled, vaguely British isles, laid-back atmosphere.  Mixed drinks are strong and PBR is $2.  I've been here twice for Your Latest Crush, an indiepop dance/DJ night that they have here on the last Friday of every month, and that alone makes House of Shields a little cooler by association.  As far as I know, it's the only event quite like it in SF.  Check it out!
author: Lego S.

description: A great quaint bar in an awesome location. Great beer selection and I loved the price. There was some good seating as well. This is the perfect after work hangout.
author: Adam C.

description: I count myself as 3 stars lucky to work above House of Shields. Some days just require a margarita in a pint glass after work. House of Shields provides. Only three stars because, for a prime downtown location, I want happy hour specials.
author: reb f.

description: I'm usually already drunk when I saunter in, so this place might be better or worse than I think.  Anyway, I like going here cause it's dive-y and stumbling distance from MUNI/BART.  Bartenders dont have an attitude and they mix good drinks.  The space is dark and the seating sparse and dilapidated.  Good place to end the evening.
author: brewgirl b.

description: This fine joint is quickly becoming my favorite bar in the city. For one, it has the feel of a WW2-era pub. In addition, the bartenders are always quick and nice. And the music selection is eclectic without trying to be too hip (Nick Drake, Elliott Smith, etc.). And the clientele is a mixed bag, which is more and more uncommon in this fractured city. I dig this place.
author: K F.

description: This place is ok, Clean inside,Drinks not so cheap. Had a few company happy hours here but I would say the crowd tends to be your more suit and tie 38 plus type crowd but all in all not a bad place.
author: Chris D.

description: The bartenders are hot and the drinks are strong! Long live HOS (nice acronym)!
author: beatrice ..

description:
smokey atmosphere fills this bar. it's dark, crowded. i was here for a techcrunch after party called "smack your pitch up." people took turns pitching their worst start up idea ever. lots of character in this bar. a little too much character for my taste. 

3 stars.
author: Charles D.

description: What you imagine a cool old downtown bar to look like... with bike messengers. Decent selection of beer, totally unpretentious service, smallest bathroom on Earth. Live music is often good and occasionally distracting, but you're really just there to kick it and throw a few back. Oddly enough, a nice place to have a cold one after work and the gym. Oops.
author: Aaron L.

description: Finally -- a bar darker than the outside street at night, like a proper bar should be!  Decent selection of medium-tier booze, a dozen fairly ordinary beers on tap, rickety dark wood & leather seats -- all of this in the heart of downtown SF.  So now you can leave your .com job and go back in time 100 years over a pint.  Will definitely come back.
author: Eugene F.

description: I don't know why I've never been here before- this place is great. It's on the border between dive and cool. The upstairs area where the bands play is small, but it makes it way more casual. I like it. Also, if you don't want to be squished in a little space you can sit at one of the tables and watch the show on a huge screen. The bartender was a friendly one. Iike bars that are cool with no pretension!
author: Erin O.

description: Not at all a bad option in FiDi, the House of Shields is a place to drink and hear a little live music if you're lucky. The bartenders are cool, but a little aloof- they take their time, as dictated by the vibe. We kicked it to interesting Indie Pop by Your Latest Crush. Great music, room upstairs to dance.  It's not the cleanest or most well kept of FiDi bars. The stairs creek, you're thankful the corners are dark and the bathrooms are just passable. Still most nights see only a $4 cover, and the crowd is a mix of just-off-of-work I-bankers and out-on-the-town hipsters. Drinks are reasonably priced- only $5, 6 for a strong rum and diet.
author: Jenni D.

description: This is a bike messengers paradise....cool little dive bar in the "hot " part of SOMA.  Took the girls there after a long day at the office.  Although I a lover of music, the music was a little too loud this early in the evening....I couldn't hear myself think and that is nearly impossible!  bartenders were great.
author: Tracy M.

description: Booo...bartender was more like a wench than a bartender. She actually scolded my friend for taking a cherry out of the little "cocktail extras bar." CSSHHH. Plus, it's one of those narrow bars and with large crowds that just doesn't work...again with the narrow bars people..NO NO NO. The decorations were very weird too...light up men looking like they were crawling out of the bushes..weird. I don't think I'd visit again.
author: Cassy R.

description: Great architecture, but too f'ing packed with soon-to-be-yuppies for me to handle coming back. The beer selection looked good.
author: Caroline C.

description: This is an odd spot, and not in a bad way, just really strange.  I think it is the lay out that threw me for a loop.  So it is really a long galley-esque space.  Old timey bar.  The lady bartenders were quite nice.  I was there Friday and maybe it was the lighting and having the front door open, I can;t put my finger on it, but something was off.  Now at the same time, they let a loud and some what rowdy group, "us" stay there for hrs, so this a plus.
author: Nicole F.

description: Stayed right across the street, so luckly it was very accessible and the history behind the joint. Quite memorable evening. I would definitely come back here! loved the atmosphere-speakeasy and the history lesson from the very handsome bartender.
author: Parichehr M.

description: this is a place I go to only occasionally because they dont have a happy hour, but occasionally they have hot bikers.  They also serve chimay, which is a plus.  nothing too special, but not bad at all.
author: Katie Sue A.

description: On the quest to begin hitting up unpretentious happy hours located in the FiDi, I met two colleagues at the House of Shields yesterday and enjoyed a delicious Snake Bite or Black Velvet - depending on your vernacular and a Guinness. Mid 30s crowd, regulars at the bar and good small group seating. Bartender was friendly. $10 minimum on credit cards, but that's standard. Snake Bite was superior.
author: Jenny T.

description: Nice restoration.   HOS needs more bartenders.  Two were working on a Thursday 6 p.m. and with the large crowd, it took too long.  Ordered a martini up.  Woman barkeep pours ice and vodka in a glass mixer, right in front of me, then takes a huge, multiple drink order from another customer.  I sit and watch the ice melt in my drink, not yet served.  Finally, after about 6-7 mins she notices my drink and strains the water and vodka into a martini glass and services it to me without a comment.  terrible drink.  Not going back.
author: James A.

description: A great saloon to dive into for a beer or two.  Cheap prices!
author: Jeff W.

description: One of the NASTIEST bartenders ever!  Female brunette bartender was nasty and sneered at us when I kindly asked her to give back my friend's half-glass of wine that overzealous barback had scooped up. Who needs that kind of attitude?
author: karita s.

description: This place is rad!  I usually come on either tuesday or thursday because of Lexy, the best bartender in the world.  she makes some yummy mojitos and killer bloody mary's.....
author: shannon s.

description: A cramped little bar full of interesting people.  I don't drink alcohol, so I can't attest to any of the beverages there (my libation is water).  I have a nice time every time I'm there, though.  Cool place to just hang out with friends.
author: Apollo L.

description: I was a little wary about going here, but I really shouldn't have been.  The bar itself was beautiful and I really liked the booths.  The beer selection was definitely decent and fairly priced and the music playing was wonderful (Arcade Fire and the like.)
author: Kathleen Y.

description: Great Bar brought back to life by the greatness of Dennis Leary.....ALMOST everything about this place is perfect, the cleanliness, the authenticity and the ambiance, the female Bartender was great and the best of the lot as far as I'm concerned on the few evenings I have been there, she's fun. The only downside to the place is the music, I personally like the type of music that was played it but it just didn't seem to fit in with the old world atmosphere Leary is trying to create, it just threw off the ambiance of the establishment other than that it was very good.
author: francis A.

description: HELLA fun! there was only one bartender but he was cool. and as far as i could find, there was only one ladies room but the boys didn't seem to mind collab'n. it got mighty loud. Dj Quest rules. win.
author: Corneat O.

description: Another place we sometimes go to have a drink after work.  Personally, I have never been a big fan.  Sometimes it is cool to go with a group of people in take over the upstairs area, or to take over the round booth at the end of the bar, but the place is kinda dirty and the service is never that great.
author: Pele N.

description: Craving a glass of wine in the afternoon or a gin and tonic?  I cannot imagine a more perfect place to sip either and leave with a pleasant buzz while it is still light outside.  Friend or solo this place works!
author: Steven K.

description: Great atmosphere, strong drinks and cute college boys from the art school. What more could you ask for in a bar?
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place looks awesome but the crowd is, as my friend would say, F.O.D. (full of douche). I can usually only tolerate a couple of drinks in this place before I have to find somewhere where the shirt collars are not quite as turned up.
author: Andrew L.

description:
my experience with this place is pretty much bad news.  it seems like every time i go here it's either at the beginning or the end of what, unintentionally, is a binge night, essentially.

pretty divey place, dark inside.  the bartenders aren't much to look at (come to think of it, neither is most of the crowd, for that matter...tattooed and pierced bicyclists, a few yuppies...usually should be all good, but not here for some reason...) ...oh yeah, back to the bartenders, not much to look at, but always nice.

so yeah, if you're looking for a place in the middle of downtown to duck into and get trashed, this is it.

oh, also, one night i ended up in there until something like 430, almost five in the morning, drinking and smoking with the bartender and a few others that he let stay.  getting home drunk as shit while the sun is starting to rise is always an interesting experience.
author: Coe S.

description:
Oh House of Shields.  Another of my home away from homes.  I've been coming here for years and have always felt welcome and comfortable, even when I sometimes shouldn't have been.

Also, for the last couple of years this is where I do my weekly update drink nights, where I meet up with whichever of my Acadamy friends that are available that night and we catch up.  

This semester it's been friday nights, which brings me to the only reason I won't give HoS five stars.  The Friday night live bands.  Sometimes they're not so bad, especially if it's quiter music, but often times they're just horrendous, too loud and too untalented.  I frequent bars like HoS so that I can have conversations with friends, bartenders, and people that I meet there.  When the music is so loud I have to scream that's not as much fun.

Still, I understand why they do it, as I'm sure the local bands bring a bunch of their friends in with them when they play.
author: Michael S.

description: I love the House of Shields, because it's been kind of forgotten so it's almost like a low-key, hidden gem for those in the know. It's a really nice historic dark bar, with wood booths and great atmosphere... And it's a nice counterpoint to the elegant Victorian Palace Hotel across the street, and all the hip  edgy SOMA galleries/watering holes nearby. The music is always "chill" and cool, and its got a sexy relaxed vibe to it. The times I've been there (midweek), the crowd there is always fun without being obnoxious or too loud, and the bartenders are bit snarky...So it's got a mixture of being this unpretentious contemporary cool crowd but in a historic and authentic "Old San Francisco" setting. I agree with some other reviewers, about this place being great to unwind...Its almost like if a bar could be equivalent to comfort food, this place would be it! Add a dash of some artistic romanticism and a little cozy warmth: and you've got the recipe for a very fine evening to accompany your libations.
author: Risa F.

description: i had always wondered about this place. i thoght it was a restaurant till i wandered in on a saturday night with a friend. interesting bar... low-key and seems to have a lot of history. i like the way its set up. it was still early and not so crowded but the bartenders were very friendly so we stayed awhile.
author: Michelle I.

description: my house away from house, and i dont even drink! it's the owner, schlomo rabinowitz-slutsky -- he's an amazing man, bartender and mc of any party you need to have there. plus, the bike messengers hang out there and they are nice eye candy, tho not good boyfriend material as they tend to crash into cars often.
author: irina s.

description: not only did i meet yelpers here, but i had the most fabulous bloody mary that ever existed on earth! the bartenders were wonderful and didnt roll their eyes at you when you ordered something besides beer. although the seating isnt bountiful, you can still stare people down (cassio) or silently glide over to there table when they desert it for just a minute. a great joint with a super friendly atmosphere, i'm defintely down for more yelp happy hours here!
author: Aly L.

description: High ceilings.  Lots of wood.  Some yuppie lady said" I'd like something stiff'.  The chick behind the bar answered, "to drink"?  I will be back.
author: Daniel K.

description: this bar used to be fun. now it's just real expensive with bad bartenders with attitude.  even the trashy ho's were nicer than these guys.  i think the bartenders are using the bar as their private pick up joint since they don't seem to want to serve men.  however, if you are a woman they'll make a packed bar full of a 100 people wait while they work on looking down at some girls tits and trying to get digits. i guess they remodeled but i can't tell the difference. i think the only thing that was remodeled was the attitude.  it's a total snob place now.  make sure wearing your biz suit when you go in there or you will be ignored.  hey jerk off bartenders, last time i checked my visa works just as well when i'm in gym shorts or a suit!
author: T D.

description: hooray! a fidi bar where people are just being regular people. very dark, very low-profile. i've been here quite a few times for happy hour and always have fun. last night the bartender was really cool and i noticed you could get a pabst blue ribbon for $2. made me a little nostalgiac for times past, when i enjoyed cans o' pabst on beaches and in homes vacated of parents. here's to you, PBR.
author: rachel m.

description: used to come here quite a bit for lunch in the old days before its refurb - seems a bit cleaner, but i miss the 3-piece combo at lunchtimes and i don't think they serve food any more - it is definitely a bit too dark - it would be nice to have small lamps in each of the booths - do NOT order the blanc de blancs brut sparkling wine - it's the cheaper one at $6 a glass (served in the old-school-style glass), but your stomach will be very unhappy shortly thereafter - they should serve a better wine at $8/glass and ditch the cheapo one (i didn't try the one they serve at $7/glass)
author: Nancy M.

description: cool bar to chill for happy hour.  i liked it better thought when it was a restaurant bar.
author: Pickle R.

description: This is a really great authentic bar.  It has an East Coast or Old World feel to it.   The crowd is diverse, the bartenders are really cool and friendly and they have those big old pre-war porcelain urinals.  What more could you ask for?
author: Larry T.

description: Unlike most bars in SF, the House of Shields can make a killer Irish Car Bomb. They do it right - big and no shorting the whiskey.. fun atmosphere for happy hour.. good place to stop before / after 111 Minna on wednesdays. the crowd can be hit or miss, but never too disappointing if you're looking to socialize.
author: David F.

description: Sweet jeebers I love this place. Good drinks, hot bartenders, good tunes.  What the fuck else do you want?
author: Charles H.

description: I guess yelp cannot take criticisms, only dish it out? Why was my post removed? Actually, I was there that night (as well as many nights ... HOS is one of my favorite bars in the city). The bartender was not fired, she had already given notice and was moving on to bigger and better things (she said afterwards). I think one too many prissy as$ yuppie customers ordering expensive drinks and being cheap with the tip pushed her over the edge. That bar was packed full that night and she was the only one there (great owner eh? real professional....saving a few minimum wage hours while causing employees to bust their asses). The yelp crew was prissy, yuppyish, pretentious, and obviously out of place. If you didn't like the service, why did you stay and run up a 200$ tab? Why not just go to any of the bars within 1/2 block that are more friendly to your snotty ilk? They are not understaffed and over worked and there would be some other prissy yuppy there to wait on you hand and foot. But no, you stayed, ordered 200$ worth of drinks, all the while planning your little purile revenge by stiffing a minimum wage worker who was serving 200+ people solo out of her sole source of income. You suck and you're exactly what I suspected yelp employees to be like. I also work around the corner and request that you stay out of my bar...better experience for everyone...no I am not the bartender and I don't know her, but I did witness the event and as someone who used to have to serve shallow self-entitled customers while I worked my way through college, I completely understand her bitter rage. She was near tears when you left ... jerks. Hope you had a good sense of satisfaction.
author: jojo b.
